Work About

Educating borrowers on the benefits of a cosigner

Earnest   •   Web app

The Scope
--Re-do this-- User Research, User Experience Design, Information Architecture, Visual Design
Timeline
Increased click-through rate by 16%, thereby increasing cosigners invited by 13%.
The Company
Earnest is a technology-enabled student loan lender and refinancer.
The Challenge

83% of Earnest’s student loan applicants needed a cosigner, but after completing an eligibility check, they dropped off citing “not wanting” one. I redesigned the Results Screen of our eligiblity check to better convey the benefits of a cosigner, and thus increase conversion.

SELECTED SCREENS

Three interactive ways to understand student loan debt

RESEARCH

Understanding how student borrowers thought about adding a cosigner

In order to understand what information student loan borrowers pay attention to and what they want to know when it comes to their student loans, I interviewed 8 loan borrowers, both in person and via Usertesting.com.

Based on these conversations, I came away with a few key insights to inform my designs:

1. Optimization minded:
Borrowers want to know how much interest is accruing and how to pay off loans efficiently to minimize it.
2. Focus on wins:
Borrowers find their payoff date demoralizing. They want to see what their effort has accomplished.
3. Original balance is a footnote:
Borrowers know their original loan balance and are not interested in it outside of the context of other metrics.
Designed and developed by yours truly. 2021.
